questions.question: Who checks, before flight, that the aircraft's weight is such that the flight can be safely made, and that any transported cargo is properly distributed and secured?
options: The mechanic on board, or in his absence the co-pilot

questions.question: FDRs must keep data and parameters for at least the last:
When refuelling is being conducted with passengers embarking or disembarking:
options: refuelling is strictly prohibited whilst passengers are embarking/ disembarking
all flight crew must be on board
communications shall be maintained by ground crew and qualified crew on board
the stairs shall be fully extended
questions.solution: communications shall be maintained by ground crew and qualified crew on board

questions.question: To act as co-pilot for take-off or landing you must have:
options: acted as PIC or co-pilot on type in the last 90 days
acted as PIC or co-pilot on type in the last 30 days
acted as PIC or co-pilot on type in the last 60 days
been at the controls for landing in the same type recently
questions.solution: acted as PIC or co-pilot on type in the last 90 days

questions.question: When are life jackets required?
Where is the Minimum Equipment List?
Aeroplanes with a take-off mass greater than 5700 kg shall be fitted with an independent automatically operated emergency power supply to operate and illuminate the artificial horizon for:

One shall not initiate any flight made in accordance with instrument flight rules unless the available information indicates that the conditions at the aerodrome of intended destination and destination alternate (if one is required) are, at the predicted time of:
options: take-off equal to or better than the minimum conditions required for aerodrome use
arrival, and for a reasonable time before and after such a predicted time, equal to minimum conditions required for aerodrome use
arrival equal to or better than the minimum conditions required for aerodrome use
arrival better than the minimum conditions required for aerodrome use
questions.solution: arrival equal to or better than the minimum conditions required for aerodrome use

questions.question: What is the co-pilot currency requirement?
options: 3 take-offs and landings in the last 60 days
At the controls for 3 flights in the last 60 days
At the controls for 3 take-offs and landings in the last 90 days
questions.solution: At the controls for 3 take-offs and landings in the last 90 days

questions.question: Supplemental oxygen is used to:
options: provide oxygen to passengers who might require it, following a cabin depressurization
assist a passenger with breathing difficulties
protect a crew member who fights a fire
provide passengers on board with oxygen during a cabin depressurization
questions.solution: provide oxygen to passengers who might require it, following a cabin depressurization

questions.question: Information concerning evacuation procedures can be found in the:
Where is the general information about the carriage of dangerous goods to be found?
The Minimum Equipment List (MEL) is established by the:
options: aeronautical Authority the airline operator depends on
Civil Aviation Authority of the European states

questions.question: The recent experience conditions of a captain assigned to a flight on an aircraft by an operator must not be less than:
options: 6 take-offs and 6 landings as pilot in command on this type of aircraft during the last 90 days
3 take-offs and 3 landings as pilot in command on this type of aircraft during the last 6 months
6 take-offs and 6 landings as pilot in command on this type of aircraft during the last 6 months
3 take-offs and 3 landings as pilot in command on this type of aircraft during the last 90 days
questions.solution: 3 take-offs and 3 landings as pilot in command on this type of aircraft during the last 90 days

questions.question: A piece of equipment on your public transport aeroplane fails while you are still parked. The reference document you use to decide on the procedure to follow is the:
When do you not need a destination alternate aerodrome?
options: If the flight time is more than 6 hours and a reasonable time before and after you can expect VMC
If your operator deems the weather to be suitable for a visual landing
If the flight time is less than 1 hour
If there is a reasonable certainty that at the ETA at the destination aerodrome
questions.solution: If there is a reasonable certainty that at the ETA at the destination aerodrome

questions.question: When are all flight crew members required to be at their stations?
options: At all times except when they need to leave for operational or physiological reasons
At all times other than take-off and landing

questions.question: When are flight crew allowed to leave their stations?
options: In the performance of their duties
At any time specified by the OM
Only when the captain allows it
questions.solution: In the performance of their duties

questions.question: Who is the operator to provide an operations manual for?
What must be ensured with respect to navigation equipment?
options: The failure of one piece does not affect another
All navigation equipment must be serviceable at the start of flight
All equipment must conform to ICAO specifications
If one piece of equipment fails there must be a spare available
questions.solution: The failure of one piece does not affect another

questions.question: What skills constitute pilot proficiency checks?
options: Flying technique, emergency procedures and IFR
The ability to conform with set procedures
questions.solution: Flying technique, emergency procedures and IFR

questions.question: How often should pilot proficiency checks be performed?
options: No less than 6 months between checks
3 checks within the year with no less than 4 months between checks
2 within a year, more than 4 months between checks
questions.solution: 2 within a year, more than 4 months between checks

questions.question: Who is to ensure safe handling of flights?
Destination alternate for a turbojet - what is the required fuel overhead?
options: 30 minutes at 1500 ft in standard conditions
2 hours at 1500 ft in standard conditions
questions.solution: 30 minutes at 1500 ft in standard conditions

questions.question: Who is responsible for ensuring that the aeroplane is airworthy prior to flight?
Following an indication of an unserviceability whilst taxiing to the holding point, what do you consult first?
Above what altitude are quick-donning masks required?
What is the oxygen requirement for the crew and 100% of the passengers in an unpressurized aircraft?
What is the requirement regarding the carriage of a CVR for aircraft registered before April 1998?
options: Record for the duration of the flight
Record the last 25 hours of operation
Record the last 48 hours of flight

questions.question: What is the requirement for the carriage of life rafts?
options: 30 mins or 120 NM whichever is less
120 mins or 400 NM whichever is less
60 mins flying time at the one engine out cruise speed
questions.solution: 120 mins or 400 NM whichever is less

questions.question: Flight crew members on the flight deck shall keep their safety belt fastened:
options: only during take-off and landing and whenever necessary by the commander in the interest of safety

questions.question: The EU-OPS document is based on:
On an ILS, you are told that the weather has dropped below company minima. When must you abort the approach?
options: Start of the glide slope descent

questions.question: The MEL is drawn up by the:
options: operator and may be more restrictive than the MMEL
operator and may be less restrictive than the MMEL
manufacturer and may be more restrictive than the MMEL
manufacturer and may be less restrictive than the MMEL
questions.solution: operator and may be more restrictive than the MMEL

questions.question: On board a pressurized aircraft, a flight shall be undertaken only if the aircraft is provided with an oxygen reserve enabling all crew members and part of the passengers to be supplied with oxygen in the event of cabin depressurization, throughout the flight period, during which the pressure altitude is greater than:
A modern aircraft must be provided with a flight data recorder when its certified MTOM is greater than:
Who provides the operations personnel with the OM and the amendments to keep it up to date?
options: ATS authority of the State of Registry

questions.question: What is required for navigation in IMC?
options: Radio equipment and equipment for guidance until the visual point
One VHF box and one HF box
questions.solution: Radio equipment and equipment for guidance until the visual point

questions.question: Who compiles the MEL and where does it go?
options: The manufacturer and in the AFM
The manufacturer and in the OM
The operator and in the AFM
The operator and in the OM
questions.solution: The operator and in the OM

questions.question: On an NDB approach with an MDH of 360 ft and a required RVR of 1500 m and a reported met vis of 2500 m, when can you start an approach; i.e. which is most correct?
options: When the cloud base is above the system minimum
When the cloud base is above 36 ft
When the cloud base report is received

questions.question: Where is permanent approval for the carriage of dangerous goods given?
How far away can a take-off alternate be for a 2-engine aeroplane?
options: 60 mins at one engine cruise speed
120 mins at one engine cruise speed
questions.solution: 60 mins at one engine cruise speed

questions.question: Who issues and updates the MEL?
Who accepts the MEL?
options: The country where the flight takes place

questions.question: A Flight Data Recorder is required in aeroplanes over:

In determining Aerodrome Operating Minima, what of the following needs to be considered? 1. Crew composition 2. Ability to communicate/receive meteorological information 3. Significant obstacles in the missed approach area 4. Dimensions and characteristics of the runway 5. Navigation equipment in the aeroplane
A list to be carried in the aeroplane detailing minimum equipment required must be approved by:
options: no such book is required to be approved by an authority

questions.question: A pilot in command: 1. must comply with ATC instructions immediately 2. is only responsible when airborne 3. may deviate in an emergency 4. may deviate from complying with rules of the air in order to comply with an ATC instruction 5. may request a new clearance if unsatisfied
If there is unauthorized use of equipment that affects the aeroplane's system, the commander:
options: may authorize its use for take-off and landing
may authorize its use for the whole flight
may authorize its use at his discretion

questions.question: What is the currency requirement for a co-pilot?
options: 3 take-offs and landings on an aeroplane of the same type within the last 90 days
3 take-offs and landings on an aeroplane of the same type within the last 60 days
3 take-offs and landings on an aeroplane of the same type or approved simulator within the last 90 days
3 take-offs and landings on an aeroplane of the same type or approved simulator within the last 60 days
questions.solution: 3 take-offs and landings on an aeroplane of the same type or approved simulator within the last 90 days

questions.question: From the flight deck you observe an aeroplane in the forward left position on an opposite parallel track. What Nav light will be observed?
The MMEL is:
options: compiled by the manufacturer and approved by the operator
compiled by the manufacturer and approved by the state of design or state of the manufacturer
compiled by the operator and approved by the state of design
compiled by the manufacturer and not approved by the operator
questions.solution: compiled by the manufacturer and approved by the state of design or state of the manufacturer

questions.question: All aeroplanes which individual certificates of airworthiness were issued after 1 January 1990 must be fitted with a flight data recorder when their maximum certificated take-off mass is greater than:
The operator shall include in the OM a MEL which shall be approved by the authority of:
options: the country where the aeroplane is operated
the country where the aeroplane was manufactured

questions.question: At the alternate aerodrome, the commander of a turbojet engine aeroplane should have a fuel quantity (final reserve) sufficient for flying during:
options: 30 minutes at holding flight speed at 1500 ft
45 minutes at holding flight speed at 1500 ft
questions.solution: 30 minutes at holding flight speed at 1500 ft

questions.question: The Minimum Equipment List (MEL) gives the equipment which can be inoperative when undertaking a flight and the additional procedures to be observed accordingly. This list is prepared by:
options: the operator, and it is inserted in the OM
the manufacturer, and it is inserted in the OM
the operator, and it is appended in the AFM
the manufacturer, and it is appended to the AFM
questions.solution: the operator, and it is inserted in the OM

questions.question: After an accident, the operator of an aeroplane equipped with a flight recorder must keep the original recordings for a minimum period of:
During a flight, the captain is informed that a passenger is using a portable electronic device, which is adversely affecting the aircraft's electrical avionics. The captain must:
options: stop the passenger from using the device
allow the device to be used at take-off and landing
allow the device to be used from take-off to landing
allow the device to be used for certain exceptions
questions.solution: stop the passenger from using the device

questions.question: A copy of which of the following documents must be kept on the ground by an operator for the duration of each flight?
options: The ATC (Air Traffic Control) flight plan

questions.question: What manuals are to be carried?
options: Company instructions for all flight crew
All those specified in the CofA
Relevant parts of the ops manual and AFM
questions.solution: Relevant parts of the ops manual and AFM

questions.question: A copy of what info is to be left on the ground?
options: Passenger manifests, notification of special passengers
NOTAMS, tech log, op flight plan, mass & Balance, spec load notification
AICs, AISs, and all company NOTAMS
questions.solution: NOTAMS, tech log, op flight plan, mass & Balance, spec load notification

questions.question: Which of the following is to be left on the ground?
options: Parts of the operations manual relevant to the flight

questions.question: Each flight is subject to a preliminary file collecting a certain amount of information. The operator will see that this file is kept on ground. It particularly contains: 1. one copy of the operational flight plan and, if required, the weight and balance sheet 2. the weather conditions for the day including the weather forecast at destination 3. charts 4. copies of the relevant aircraft's technical log 5. the en route NOTAM documentation when specifically issued by the operator 6. special loads notification. The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:
The first part of EU-OPS is applicable to:
options: international commercial air transport of JAA state members
questions.solution: international commercial air transport of JAA state members

questions.question: After an incident, the FDR recordings must be kept for:
Coverage of permanently illuminated white lights at the rear of the aircraft is:
The first part of the EU-OPS document relates to:
options: aircraft proceeding from or over flying European States
JAA state operators flying civil commercial air transport aeroplanes
treatment of passengers with pathological respiratory disorders
questions.solution: JAA state operators flying civil commercial air transport aeroplanes

questions.question: What is the requirement for the issue of an AOC?
options: Not already hold an AOC issued by another authority
Have a fleet of serviceable aeroplanes
Have registered offices in all countries of operations
questions.solution: Not already hold an AOC issued by another authority

questions.question: The "NO SMOKING" sign must be illuminated:
options: when oxygen is being supplied in the cabin
in each cabin section if oxygen is being carried
questions.solution: when oxygen is being supplied in the cabin

questions.question: What are the rules on the carriage of PRMs?
options: Cannot impede the performance of crew duty
Must be seated away from emergency exits
No more than 5% of passengers may be PRMs
They must provide their own food
questions.solution: Cannot impede the performance of crew duty

questions.question: What is the system minimum for an NDB approach?

What is the minimum required RVR for CAT IIIB operations?
What is the minimum visibility for a Cat A aircraft during a circling approach?
A category II precision approach (CAT II) is an approach with:
options: a decision height of at least 100 ft
a decision height of at least 200 ft
a decision height of at least 50 ft
questions.solution: a decision height of at least 100 ft

questions.question: When can special VFR be commenced?
What is VA?
options: The lesser of VS0 or VS1g

questions.question: According to EU-OPS 1.430 (Aerodrome Operating Minima) a Category IIIA approach has a Decision Height of less than 100 ft and a minimum RVR of:
What is the take-off RVR limit for a Cat A aeroplane, when high intensity centre line lights and edge lights are on and the crew is IFR qualified and approved?
options: 150 m if threshold RVR is available

questions.question: When is MDH referenced to the threshold as opposed to the aerodrome elevation?
options: The threshold is more than 2 m above the ARP
The threshold is less than 2 m above the ARP
The threshold is less than 2 m below the ARP
The threshold is more than 2 m below the ARP
questions.solution: The threshold is more than 2 m below the ARP

What is the minimum horizontal visibility for a Cat D aircraft on a circling approach?
What is DH used for?

EU-OPS 1.465 (VFR operating minima), establishes that, the operator shall ensure about VFR flights, that:
options: for conducted VFR flights in airspace F, vertical distance from clouds is 250 m at least
Special VFR flights are not commenced when visibility is less than 3 km
for conducted VFR flights in airspace B, horizontal distance from clouds is 1000 m at least
for conducted VFR flights in airspace E, flight visibility at and above 3050 m (10000 ft) is 5 km at least (clear of cloud)
questions.solution: Special VFR flights are not commenced when visibility is less than 3 km

options: When threshold and mid-runway RVRs are greater than 800 m
When all 3 RVRs are greater than 800 m
When the met viz is greater than 800 m. RVR is for precision approaches only
When threshold RVR is greater than 800 m
questions.solution: When threshold RVR is greater than 800 m
